attributes.action: Stop Halifax Bank charging £5 per day for use of an unauthorised overdraft
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Halifax Bank was bailed out with taxpayers money.
It is therefore nothing short of scandalous that they are charging customers £5 PER DAY for use of an unauthorised overdraft.
In a time of severe recession, this is both unfair and extortionate.
With a general election due in 6 months time, how can the government justify a taxpayer bailed out bank doing this?

rejection.details: You cannot refer to a specific commercial organisation by name in your petition. This is potentially libellous. I suggest that you resubmit a more generic petition requesting legislation relating to overdraft charges.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
